biomes.name: Ancient's Landing
biomes.description:
Ancient's Landing is a biome in Eternity Isle, available only in the paid expansion A Rift in Time.

It is the first biome unlocked, and is located on the south side of Eternity Isle. It's unlocked at no cost immediately after purchasing the expansion and beginning the quest The Port of Many Worlds.

biomes.name: Dazzle Beach
biomes.description:
Dazzle Beach is a biome in Dreamlight Valley.

It is located in the southern coastal area connected to the Peaceful Meadow, the Forest of Valor and the Glade of Trust.

The thorns blocking the pathway to this biome can be cleared using 1,000 Dreamlight.

biomes.name: Everafter
biomes.description: Everafter is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

biomes.name: Forest of Valor
biomes.description:
Forest of Valor is a forested biome in Dreamlight Valley.

It is located on the east side of the Valley connected to the Plaza, Peaceful Meadow, and Frosted Heights.

The thorns blocking the pathway to this biome can be cleared using 3,000 Dreamlight.

biomes.name: Forgotten Lands
biomes.description:
The Forgotten Lands is a dark forest biome in Dreamlight Valley.

It is located in the north-west side of the Valley connected to the Sunlit Plateau.

The thorns blocking the pathway to this biome can be cleared using 15,000 Dreamlight.

biomes.name: Frosted Heights
biomes.description:
The Frosted Heights is a snowy biome in Dreamlight Valley.

It is located on the north-east side of the Valley connected to the Forest of Valor.

The thorns blocking the pathway to this biome can be cleared using 10,000 Dreamlight.

biomes.name: Glade of Trust
biomes.description:
The Glade of Trust is a biome in Dreamlight Valley.

It is located on on the south-west side of the Valley, connected to the Peaceful Meadow, and Dazzle Beach.

The thorns blocking the pathway to this biome can be cleared using 5,000 Dreamlight.

biomes.name: Glittering Dunes
biomes.description:
The Glittering Dunes is a biome in Eternity Isle, available after purchasing the expansion A Rift in Time.

It is located on the north-west side of Eternity Isle.

The broken bridge blocking the pathway to this biome can be repaired using 2,000 Mist during the quest The Sands in the Hourglass.

biomes.name: Mount Olympus
biomes.description: Mount Olympus is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

biomes.name: Mythopia
biomes.description: Mythopia is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

biomes.name: Peaceful Meadow
biomes.description:
The Peaceful Meadow is a biome in Dreamlight Valley.

It is the second area players will discover, and is located to the south of the Plaza. It is further connected to the Glade of Trust, Dazzle Beach, and the Forest of Valor.

biomes.name: Plaza
biomes.description:
The Plaza is the area of Dreamlight Valley where the game begins.

It's located in the center of the map, and connected to the Peaceful Meadow, the Sunlit Plateau, and the Forest of Valor. It is also the only biome connected to the entrance to the Dream Castle.

biomes.name: Sunlit Plateau
biomes.description:
The Sunlit Plateau is a savanna-like biome in Dreamlight Valley.

It is located on the west side of the Valley, connected to the Plaza and Forgotten Lands. It also contains the entrance to the Vitalys Mines, which unlocks during the quest Nature & Nurture.

The thorns blocking the pathway to this biome can be cleared using 7,000 Dreamlight.

biomes.name: Teapot Falls
biomes.description:
Teapot Falls is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

It is the first biome the player must unlock after its subregion The Library of Lore. The Library of Lore region is unlocked at no cost immediately after purchasing the expansion and beginning the introductory quest.

biomes.name: The Beanstalk Marshes
biomes.description:
The Beanstalk Marshes is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

It is the first biome the player must unlock after its subregion The Library of Lore. The Library of Lore region is unlocked at no cost immediately after purchasing the expansion and beginning the introductory quest.

biomes.name: The Bind
biomes.description:
The Bind is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

It is the first biome the player must unlock after its subregion The Library of Lore. The Library of Lore region is unlocked at no cost immediately after purchasing the expansion and beginning the introductory quest.

biomes.name: The Elysian Fields
biomes.description: The Elysian Fields is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

biomes.name: The Fallen Fortress
biomes.description:
The Fallen Fortress is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

It is the first biome the player must unlock after its subregion The Library of Lore. The Library of Lore region is unlocked at no cost immediately after purchasing the expansion and beginning the introductory quest.

biomes.name: The Fiery Plains
biomes.description: The Fiery Plains is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

biomes.name: The Library of Lore
biomes.description:
The Library of Lore is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

It is the first biome the player must unlock after its subregion The Library of Lore. The Library of Lore region is unlocked at no cost immediately after purchasing the expansion and beginning the introductory quest.

biomes.name: The Statue's Shadow
biomes.description: The Statue's Shadow is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

biomes.name: The Wild Woods
biomes.description:
The Wild Woods is a biome in Storybook Vale, available only in the paid expansion The Storybook Vale.

It is the first biome the player must unlock after its subregion The Library of Lore. The Library of Lore region is unlocked at no cost immediately after purchasing the expansion and beginning the introductory quest.

biomes.name: Wild Tangle
biomes.description:
The Wild Tangle is a biome in Eternity Isle, available after purchasing the expansion A Rift in Time.

It is located on the north-east side of Eternity Isle.

The broken bridge blocking the pathway to this biome can be repaired using 2,000 Mist during the quest The Sands in the Hourglass.

characters.name: Aladdin
characters.description: Aladdin is a character from the Disney film Aladdin (1992).
rewards:
Diamond in the Rough Loafers
Diamond in the Rough Top
Diamond in the Rough Trousers
Diamond in the Rough Vest

characters.name: Alice
characters.description: Alice is a character from the Disney film Alice in Wonderland (1951). She is unlocked after opening the Alice in Wonderland Realm, completing the quest Leaving Wonderland, and placing Alice's House.

characters.name: Anna
characters.description:
Anna is a character from the Disney films Frozen (2013), Frozen II (2019).
She's unlocked after traveling to the Frozen Realm.

characters.name: Ariel
characters.description:
Ariel is a character from the Disney film The Little Mermaid (1989).
She lives in the water, which can make speaking with her difficult if she's too far from shore. After completing Prince Eric's friendship quest Part of His World, she'll be able to return to land, making speaking to her much easier.
rewards:
Ariel's Seafoam Gown,
Ariel's Seafoam Suit

characters.name: Belle
characters.description: Belle is a character from the Disney film Beauty and the Beast (1991).
rewards:
Royal Gold Ball Gown
Royal Gold Ballroom Suit

characters.name: Buzz Lightyear
characters.description: Buzz Lightyear is a character from Disney and Pixar's Toy Story franchise.

characters.name: Cheshire Cat
characters.description: Cheshire Cat is a character from the Disney film Alice in Wonderland (1951).

characters.name: Daisy
characters.description: Daisy Duck is a character from the classic Disney cartoons.

characters.name: Donald Duck
characters.description:
Donald Duck is a character from the classic Disney cartoons.
The player will first encounter Donald's boat-home floating on the water after unlocking Dazzle Beach. Donald himself can be found after completing the Story Quest Lost in the Dark Grove from Kristoff in the Forest of Valor.

characters.name: EVE
characters.description: EVE (Extraterrestrial Vegetation Evaluator) is a character from the Disney-Pixar film WALL-E (2008).

characters.name: Elsa
characters.description: Elsa is a character from the Disney films Frozen (2013), Frozen II (2019).

characters.name: Flynn
characters.description: Flynn is a character from the Disney film Tangled (2010). He is encountered during the Story quest A Sheep in Wolf's Clothing in one of the Everafter Trials.

characters.name: Gaston
characters.description: Gaston is a character from the Disney film Beauty and the Beast (1991).

characters.name: Goofy
characters.description:
Goofy is a character from the classic Disney cartoons.
When the player arrives in Dreamlight Valley Goofy already lives there and has a house located in the Peaceful Meadow.

characters.name: Hades
characters.description: Hades is a character from the Disney film Hercules (1997). He is encountered during the Story quest Guts & Glory in one of the Mythopia Trials.

characters.name: Jack Skellington
characters.description: Jack Skellington is a character from the Disney film The Nightmare Before Christmas (1993).

characters.name: Jafar
characters.description: Jafar is a character from the Disney film Aladdin (1992).
rewards:
Jeweled Vizier Top
Jeweled Vizier Trousers

characters.name: Jasmine
characters.description: Jasmine is a character from the Disney film Aladdin (1992).
rewards:
Desert Bloom Necklace
Desert Bloom Slip-Ons
Desert Bloom Top
Desert Bloom Trousers

characters.name: Kristoff
characters.description:
Kristoff is a character from the 2013 Disney film Frozen.
He's available to unlock after clearing the path to the Forest of Valor.

characters.name: Maleficent
characters.description: Maleficent is a character from the Disney film Sleeping Beauty (1959). She is a currently a non-resident of the Valley, and although she offers a story related quest on The Storybook Vale, she does not (yet) have a house, friendship level or rewards.

characters.name: Maui
characters.description:
Maui is a character from the film Moana (2016).
He's encountered after travelling through one of the initial three realm gates to the Moana Realm, and can be invited to the Valley after completing his necessary quests and placing/purchasing his home.

characters.name: Merida
characters.description: Merida is a character from the Disney-Pixar film Brave (2012). She is encountered in the first biome in The Storybook Vale, The Bind.

characters.name: Merlin
characters.description:
Merlin is a character from the Disney film The Sword in the Stone (1963).
He is the first villager players encounter when beginning the game.

characters.name: Mickey Mouse
characters.description:
Mickey Mouse is a character from the classic Disney cartoons.
When the player arrives in Dreamlight Valley Mickey already lives there and has a home in the Plaza.

characters.name: Mike Wazowski
characters.description: Mike Wazowski is a character from the Disney-Pixar film Monsters, Inc. (2001).

characters.name: Minnie Mouse
characters.description: Minnie Mouse is a character from the classic Disney cartoons.

characters.name: Mirabel
characters.description:
Mirabel Madrigal is a character from the 2021 animated film Encanto.
She is unlocked after completing The Golden Doorknob quest and placing Mini-Casita anywhere in the Valley.
rewards:
Teal Dreamlore Poncho,
Emerald Dreamlore Skirt

characters.name: Moana
characters.description:
Moana is a character from the film Moana (2016).
She's encountered after travelling through one of the initial three realm gates to the Moana Realm, and can be invited to the Valley after completing her necessary quests and placing/purchasing her home.

characters.name: Mother Gothel
characters.description: Mother Gothel is a character from the Disney film Tangled (2010).

characters.name: Mulan
characters.description: Mulan is a character from the Disney film Mulan (1998).

characters.name: Mushu
characters.description: Mushu is a character from the Disney film Mulan (1998).

characters.name: Nala
characters.description: Nala is a character from the Disney film The Lion King (1994).

characters.name: Olaf
characters.description:
Olaf is a character from the Disney films Frozen (2013), Frozen II (2019).
He can be found in a cave at Frosted Heights

characters.name: Oswald
characters.description: Oswald is a character from several animated short films under the series "Oswald the Lucky Rabbit" released to theaters from 1927 to 1938, and is notable as one of Walt Disney's early creations prior to creating Mickey Mouse.

characters.name: Prince Eric
characters.description: Prince Eric is a character from the Disney film The Little Mermaid (1989).

characters.name: Pumbaa
characters.description: Pumbaa is a character from the Disney film The Lion King (1994). He is unlocked after opening The Lion King Realm, and completing the quest Where's Pumbaa?.

characters.name: Rapunzel
characters.description: Rapunzel is a character from the Disney film Tangled (2010).
rewards:
Glowing Floral Gown
Glowing Floral Suit

characters.name: Remy
characters.description:
Remy is a character from the Pixar film Ratatouille (2007).
He's encountered after travelling through one of the initial three realm gates, the Ratatouille Realm, and can be invited to the Valley after completing his necessary quests and placing/purchasing his home.

characters.name: Sally
characters.description: Sally is a character from the film The Nightmare Before Christmas (1993). She is unlocked after completing the quest The Woven Bridge.
rewards:
Patchwork Elegance Gown
Web Lace Gloves

characters.name: Scar
characters.description:
Scar is a character from the Disney film The Lion King (1994).
He's encountered after unlocking the Sunlit Plateau and completing the story quest The Curse from Mother Gothel.

characters.name: Scrooge McDuck
characters.description:
Scrooge McDuck is a character from the classic Disney cartoons.
When the player arrives in Dreamlight Valley Scrooge already lives there and has a store in the Plaza. Scrooge provides the player options to purchase and upgrade wells, stalls, and character houses as well as operating a store with a daily rotating stock of clothing and items.

characters.name: Simba
characters.description: Simba is a character from the Disney film The Lion King (1994).

characters.name: Stitch
characters.description: Stitch, also known as Experiment 626, is a character from the 2002 animated film Lilo & Stitch and its franchise.

characters.name: Sulley
characters.description: Sulley is a character from the Disney-Pixar film Monsters, Inc. (2001).

characters.name: The Beast
characters.description: The Beast is a character from the Disney film Beauty and the Beast (1991).
rewards: The Beast's Royal Blue Brocade Suit

characters.name: The Fairy Godmother
characters.description: The Fairy Godmother is a character from the Disney film Cinderella (1950).

characters.name: The Forgotten
characters.description: The Forgotten is a character original to Disney Dreamlight Valley, is the main antagonist of Act 1 of the game's story, and is responsible for the Forgetting that has darkened the Valley and erased the Villager's memories.

characters.name: The Lorekeeper
characters.description: The Lorekeeper is a character original to Disney Dreamlight Valley, and is the Player's guide through The Storybook Vale expansion pass, helping them to defeat the Neverafter

characters.name: Tiana
characters.description: Tiana is a character from the film The Princess and the Frog (2009). She can be unlocked after picking up the Mysterious Cajun Recipe Book in the Glade of Trust, and completing the quest A Taste for Literature.
rewards:
Green Flapper Dress
Green Vintage Waistcoat

characters.name: Timon
characters.description: Timon is a character from the Disney film The Lion King (1994). He is unlocked after opening The Lion King Realm, and completing the quest Where's Pumbaa?.

characters.name: Ursula
characters.description: Ursula is a character from the Disney film The Little Mermaid (1989).

characters.name: Vanellope
characters.description: Vanellope is a character from the Disney film Wreck-It Ralph (2012).

characters.name: WALL-E
characters.description:
WALL-E (Waste Allocation Load Lifter: Earth-Class) is a character from the Disney-Pixar film WALL-E (2008).
He's encountered after travelling through one of the initial three realm gates to the WALL-E Realm, and can be invited to the Valley after completing his necessary quests and placing/purchasing his home.

characters.name: Woody
characters.description: Woody is a character from Disney and Pixar's Toy Story franchise.

digging.name: Amber
digging.description: An orange rock that could be great for making jewelry.

digging.name: Bones
digging.description: Looks like somebody already ate this fish. But perhaps you could use these to build something...

digging.name: Clam
digging.description: Can be found on Dazzle Beach. Go and explore!

digging.name: Clay
digging.description: This can be made into all sorts of objects.

digging.name: Dream Shard
digging.description: A crystallized form of Dreamlight magic.

digging.name: Fairy Bubbles
digging.description: These magical bubbles can be found buried around Everafter.

digging.name: Gravel
digging.description: Old rubble found scattered throughout Mythopia.

digging.name: Mud
digging.description: Perfectly suitable for mud pies or a fancy spa day and everything in between.

digging.name: Night Shard
digging.description: The opposite of a Dream Shard. Be careful.

digging.name: Oasis Glass
digging.description: Shiny, colorful glass weathered by time.

digging.name: Pearl
digging.description: Pearl is a foraged material that can be found when digging the ground in all areas of Ancient's Landing.

digging.name: Pebbles
digging.description: You need a lot of pebbles to make a mountain...

digging.name: Sand
digging.description: An important item for building sand castles.

digging.name: Scallop
digging.description: Can be found on Dazzle Beach. Go and explore!

digging.name: Snowball
digging.description: Whatever you do, fight the urge to throw it.

digging.name: Soil
digging.description: A clump of soil that's perfect for gardening.

digging.name: Volcanic Rock
digging.description: This gray-black rock seems oddly porous and may even float.

fishing.name: Anglerfish
fishing.description: Bony fish with large mouths and sharp teeth!

fishing.name: Bass
fishing.description: Bass can be found just about everywhere in the Meadow.

fishing.name: Bones
fishing.description: Bones is a foraged material which can be found when digging the ground in any area in the Glittering Dunes or fishing open water in the Plains, Wastes, and Borderlands areas of the Glittering Dunes.

fishing.name: Bream
fishing.description: Silver-hued fish common in mountain streams.

fishing.name: Brilliant Blue Starfish
fishing.description: This starfish would make a fine addition to any sandcastle.

fishing.name: Carp
fishing.description: A common freshwater fish.

fishing.name: Catfish
fishing.description: A large fish with cat-like "whiskers."

fishing.name: Cod
fishing.description: A common fish that prefers cold water.

fishing.name: Crab
fishing.description: A tough little crustacean with sharp claws.

fishing.name: Dunebopper
fishing.description: If times get tough, this fish inflates its balloon-like lungs to float up and glide down sand dunes to the next available water source.

fishing.name: Electric Eel
fishing.description: A single zap from one of these could power a whole city. Watch out...

fishing.name: Flying Fish
fishing.description: Some say that this fish fell in love with the sky and was gifted the ability to fly for just enough time to renew its love.

fishing.name: Fugu
fishing.description: These fish inflate themselves when threatened!

fishing.name: Here and There Fish
fishing.description: Just because it doesn't look delicious doesn't mean it can't be part of a delicious meal.

fishing.name: Herring
fishing.description: These silver darlings travel in great numbers.

fishing.name: Hippocampus
fishing.description: Cousin to the hooved Hippocampus, this one thought that fins work just fine for an aquatic life.

fishing.name: Kingfish
fishing.description: A mackerel found in warmer ocean waters.

fishing.name: Koi
fishing.description: These fancy carp are rumored to have scales made from enchanted Star Coins.

fishing.name: Lamprey
fishing.description: Though intimidating, the lamprey's mouth gapes wider the more it searches for friendship.

fishing.name: Lancetfish
fishing.description: Long, slender fish with a large silver dorsal fin.

fishing.name: Lobster
fishing.description: Larger than crabs, but still with sharp claws!

fishing.name: Mussel
fishing.description: This tasty mollusk is surprisingly good at filtering water.

fishing.name: Octopus
fishing.description: This soft-bodied mollusk makes up for its lack of a shell by having a genius brain.

fishing.name: Perch
fishing.description: A rare fish found only in a special spot.

fishing.name: Pike
fishing.description: An olive green fish found in lakes and rivers.

fishing.name: Piranha
fishing.description: This little guy is cute, but watch out for those teeth.

fishing.name: Pirarucu
fishing.description: A very big fish with some very red scales.

fishing.name: Plastic Scrap
fishing.description: While it may look like garbage, it could be used to make something more.

fishing.name: Posidonia
fishing.description: This aquatic plant's fiery hue puts more sedate seaweed to shame.

fishing.name: Pretty Pink Starfish
fishing.description: This starfish adds a bit of pink to any beach.

fishing.name: Prisma Shrimp
fishing.description: You've never seen such a shrimp. Hopefully it tastes just as good as the classic-looking one.

fishing.name: Rainbow Trout
fishing.description: Its unique scales give the fish its name.

fishing.name: Red Algae
fishing.description: This rare creeping algae can be found in bodies of water across Dreamlight Valley. You think it might be able to help improve your Royal Fishing Rod somehow.

fishing.name: Robot Fish
fishing.description: Be careful when eating this. You might end up with some nuts and bolts stuck between your teeth.

fishing.name: Salmon
fishing.description: A common fish found just about everywhere!

fishing.name: Salt Crystal
fishing.description: Salt brings out the best in any dish. Best served alongside its friend: pepper.

fishing.name: Sand Fish
fishing.description: This fish may not look very pretty, but that doesn't mean it wouldn't be delicious with a bit of butter and a little spice.

fishing.name: Sand Worm
fishing.description: This insect slithers under the sand of the Glittering Dunes.

fishing.name: Scales
fishing.description: These scales must have fallen off some very beautiful fish. Now maybe you could use them to make something equally beautiful...

fishing.name: Scorpion
fishing.description: This creature is dangerous from both the front and the back.

fishing.name: Sea Grapes
fishing.description: A very edible sea alga.

fishing.name: Scales
fishing.description: Perhaps some ancient sea beasts still swim the borders of the Vale...

fishing.name: Sea Snail
fishing.description: This snail leaves a tiny trail of stars behind it as it crawls. It looks just like the Milky Way.

fishing.name: Sea Wolf
fishing.description: These deep hunters will give an uncanny aquatic howl when the moon is visible underwater.

fishing.name: Seaweed
fishing.description: A type of algae found in the ocean.

fishing.name: Shad
fishing.description: A slightly sweet, slightly salty fish that makes a great centerpiece for any dish.

fishing.name: Shrimp
fishing.description: Crustaceans that eat food off the ocean floor.

fishing.name: Sole
fishing.description: A flatfish that is shaped like a tongue!

fishing.name: Sorcerer Hat Hermit Crab
fishing.description: This isn't an ordinary hermit crab! He's in a little sorcerer hat!

fishing.name: Squid
fishing.description: Famed for their large heads and eight arms.

fishing.name: Stygian Mudskipper
fishing.description: At home on the muddy banks of the river Styx, these fish easily pass back and forth between the realms of the Living and the Dead.

fishing.name: Swordfish
fishing.description: This fish can really get its point across.

fishing.name: Tilapia
fishing.description: A small fish often found in shallow rivers.

fishing.name: Tuna
fishing.description: Large fish who make their home in the ocean.

fishing.name: Walleye
fishing.description: Large brown fish found in fresh waters.

fishing.name: White Sturgeon
fishing.description: These huge fish can live to be 100 years old!

foraging.name: Amber
foraging.description: Amber is a foraged material that can be found when digging the ground in all areas of the Wild Tangle.

foraging.name: Apple
foraging.description: A fruit that can be picked from trees.

foraging.name: Black Passion Lily
foraging.description: Black petals bloom in an ominous manner.

foraging.name: Blue Falling Penstemon
foraging.description: Blue wildflowers that droop when in bloom.

foraging.name: Blue Hydrangea
foraging.description: These must grow in special soil to turn blue.

foraging.name: Blue Marsh Milkweed
foraging.description: A rare blue variant of white marsh milkweed.

foraging.name: Blue Passion Lily
foraging.description: Blue petals bloom in an explosion of color.

foraging.name: Blue Star Lily
foraging.description: The white petals bloom from a blue center.

foraging.name: Bones
foraging.description: Bones is a foraged material which can be found when digging the ground in any area in the Glittering Dunes or fishing open water in the Plains, Wastes, and Borderlands areas of the Glittering Dunes.

foraging.name: Broken Weapon
foraging.description: A broken sword and shield.

foraging.name: Clam
foraging.description: Can be found on Dazzle Beach. Go and explore!

foraging.name: Clay
foraging.description: This can be made into all sorts of objects.

foraging.name: Coal Ore
foraging.description: Coal is a must to keep any oven running warm.

foraging.name: Common Club Rush
foraging.description: Common Club Rush is a foraged material which can be gathered from the ground in the Everafter area in Storybook Vale.

foraging.name: Cotton
foraging.description: Soft fluff that can be used in lots of stuff!

foraging.name: Crystal
foraging.description: A pretty, rare crystal used for crafting.

foraging.name: Dandelion
foraging.description: A yellow wildflower widely used in medicine.

foraging.name: Dark Wood
foraging.description: A tangle of branches waiting to become something more.

foraging.name: Dream Shard
foraging.description: A crystallized form of Dreamlight magic.

foraging.name: Dry Wood
foraging.description: A tangle of dry wood waiting to become something more.

foraging.name: Fairy Bubbles
foraging.description: These magical bubbles can be found buried around Everafter.

foraging.name: Ginger
foraging.description: Ginger is a spice type ingredient used in cooking. It can be found growing wild on the ground in the Forgotten Lands.

foraging.name: Gold Nugget
foraging.description: To think all gold coins looked like this at some point.

foraging.name: Gooseberry
foraging.description: Gooseberry is a fruit type ingredient used in cooking. It can be found growing on Gooseberry Bushes in the Frosted Heights and Forgotten Lands.

foraging.name: Gravel
foraging.description: Old rubble found scattered throughout Mythopia.

foraging.name: Green Passion Lily
foraging.description: Green petals bloom in an explosion of color.

foraging.name: Green Reward Chest
foraging.description: Green Reward Chest is an obstacle that can be cleared to collect materials. One will spawn daily anywhere outdoors in the Valley on paved or unpaved ground. They can also occasionally be found by Digging. A maximum of 3 can be in the Village at one time before they stop spawning daily. They will persist until the player clears them.

foraging.name: Green Rising Penstemon
foraging.description: Green wildflowers that rise when in bloom.

foraging.name: Hardwood
foraging.description: A pile of sturdy wood waiting to become something more.

foraging.name: Iron Ore
foraging.description: A chunk of raw iron that becomes ingots.

foraging.name: Marble
foraging.description: Marble is a foraged material which can be found mining rocks and mining nodes in the Mythopia area in Storybook Vale.

foraging.name: Moss
foraging.description: Moss is a foraged material which can be gathered using a shovel on Mossy Logs in The Bind and gathered from the ground in Everafter.

foraging.name: Mud
foraging.description: Perfectly suitable for mud pies or a fancy spa day and everything in between.

foraging.name: Night Shard
foraging.description: The opposite of a Dream Shard. Be careful.

foraging.name: Orange & Red Marsh Milkweed
foraging.description: Small orange-red bulbs bloom atop long stalks.

foraging.name: Orange Houseleek
foraging.description: A rugged flower that requires very little water.

foraging.name: Orange Marsh Milkweed
foraging.description: Small orange bulbs bloom atop long stalks.

foraging.name: Orange Nasturtium
foraging.description: Orange petals bloom from a yellow bulb.

foraging.name: Orange Star Lily
foraging.description: A bright orange flower shaped like a star.

foraging.name: Pearl
foraging.description: Pearl is a foraged material that can be found when digging the ground in all areas of Ancient's Landing.

foraging.name: Pebbles

foraging.name: Purple Marsh Milkweed

foraging.name: Purple Rising Penstemon

foraging.name: Red Algae
foraging.description: This rare creeping algae can be found in bodies of water across Dreamlight Valley. You think it might be able to help improve your Royal Fishing Rod somehow.

foraging.name: Red Bell Flower
foraging.description: A stunning red flower shaped like a bell.

foraging.name: Red Bromeliad

foraging.name: Red Daisy

foraging.name: Red Nasturtium

foraging.name: Red Passion Lily

foraging.name: Rich Soil
foraging.description: This soil can be found sometimes when harvesting crops. It's brimming with vitality and may hold great potential when mixed with the right ingredients.

foraging.name: Sand

foraging.name: Sea Monster Tooth
foraging.description: Sea Monster Tooth is a foraged material which can be caught while fishing in blue or white pools in Everafter.

foraging.name: Snowball

foraging.name: Softwood
foraging.description: A pile of softwood waiting to become something more.

foraging.name: Soil
foraging.description: A clump of soil that's perfect for gardening.

foraging.name: Stone
foraging.description: Some imagination can turn stone into art.

foraging.name: Sunflower
foraging.description: Tall yellow flowers that produce tasty seeds.

foraging.name: Tin

foraging.name: Tropical Wood
foraging.description: Tropical Wood is a foraged material which can be found on the ground near trees in all areas of the Wild Tangle.

foraging.name: Volcanic Rock
foraging.description: This gray-black rock seems oddly porous and may even float.

foraging.name: White & Pink Falling Penstemon
foraging.description: White-pink wildflowers that droop when in bloom.

foraging.name: White & Red Hydrangea
foraging.description: A hydrangea flower that has just bloomed.

foraging.name: White Bell Flower
foraging.description: A beautiful white flower shaped like a bell.

foraging.name: White Daisy
foraging.description: A white flower that symbolizes innocence.

foraging.name: White Impatiens
foraging.description: A striking bouquet of white flowers.

foraging.name: White Marsh Milkweed
foraging.description: Small white bulbs bloom atop long stalks.

foraging.name: White Passion Lily
foraging.description: A vibrant bloom of purples and whites.

foraging.name: Wrought Iron
found: Remy's daily cooking quests (After completing  Bon Appétit!)

foraging.name: Yellow Bromeliad
foraging.description: Yellow flowers that grow straight upward.

foraging.name: Yellow Daisy
foraging.description: Bright yellow petals surround a black bulb.

foraging.name: Yellow Nasturtium
foraging.description: Yellow petals bloom from a red-orange bulb.

foraging.name: Zinc
foraging.description: Zinc is a foraged material that can be found mining rock nodes in the Wild Tangle.

gardening.name: Asparagus
gardening.description: Asparagus is a perennial flowering plant species in the genus Asparagus. It was originally native to most of Europe, northern Africa, and western Asia, but has been cultivated worldwide as a food crop.

gardening.name: Bell Pepper
gardening.description: Bell pepper is a cultivar group of the species Capsicum annuum. Cultivated varieties are grouped into three colors: green, yellow, and red.

gardening.name: Canola
gardening.description: Canola is dairy and oil type ingredient used in cooking. It can be grown from Canola Seed, which is purchased from Goofy's Stall in the Forest of Valor.

gardening.name: Carrot
gardening.description: The carrot (Daucus carota) is a root vegetable often claimed to be the perfect health food. It is crunchy, tasty, and highly nutritious. Carrots are a particularly good source of beta carotene, fiber, vitamin K1, potassium, and antioxidants ( 1 ). They also have a number of health benefits.

gardening.name: Chili Pepper
gardening.description: A Chili pepper is the fruit of plants from the genus Capsicum, members of the nightshade family, Solanaceae. In Britain, Australia, Ireland, New Zealand, South Africa, India, and other English-speaking countries, the term chili pepper is used to describe all spicy peppers, regardless of species.

gardening.name: Corn
gardening.description: Corn is a tall annual cereal grass (Zea mays) that is widely grown for its large elongated ears of starchy seeds. The seeds, which are also known as corn, are used as food for humans and livestock and as a source of biofuel and can be processed into a wide range of useful chemicals.

gardening.name: Cotton
gardening.description: Soft fluff that can be used in lots of stuff!

gardening.name: Cucumber
gardening.description: Cucumber is a highly refreshing vegetable thanks to its water content, it has a low content of lipids, carbohydrates and proteins. The great vitamin C and B9 content is the most outstanding characteristic, along with its laxative properties and its capacity to relieve kidney disorders.

gardening.name: Eggplant
gardening.description: Nutritionally, eggplant is low in fat, protein, and carbohydrates. It contains relatively low amounts of numerous vitamins and minerals, such as B1, B6, folate, copper, manganese, potassium and one cup of the skin and flesh provides approximately 10 percent of the daily value of fiber.

gardening.name: Leek
gardening.description: Description. The leek is a member of the onion family, but unlike the onion, it does not form a bulb. The thick, fleshy stalk is about the same diameter at the base and resembles a large green onion without a bulb. Leaves are flattened like those of garlic.

gardening.name: Lettuce
gardening.description: lettuce, (Lactuca sativa), annual leaf vegetable of the aster family (Asteraceae). Most lettuce varieties are eaten fresh and are commonly served as the base of green salads. Lettuce is generally a rich source of vitamins K and A, though the nutritional quality varies, depending on the variety.

gardening.name: Okra
gardening.description: Okra—also known as lady's-fingers, gumbo, or bhindi—is the most important vegetable crop of the tropical and subtropical regions of the world. It belongs to the genus Abelmoschus and family Malvaceae. Okra is a multipurpose crop valued for its tender and delicious pods.

gardening.name: Onion
gardening.description: Onion, Herbaceous biennial plant (Allium cepa) of the family Alliaceae, probably native to southwestern Asia but now grown worldwide, and its edible bulb. Among the hardiest and oldest garden vegetable plants, onions bear a cluster of small, greenish white flowers on one or more leafless stalks.

gardening.name: Potato
gardening.description: The potato is a starchy food, a tuber of the plant Solanum tuberosum and is a root vegetable native to the Americas. The plant is a perennial in the nightshade family Solanaceae. Potato cultivars appear in a variety of colors, shapes, and sizes.

gardening.name: Pumpkin
gardening.description: Pumpkin is a plump, nutritious orange vegetable, and a highly nutrient dense food. It is low in calories but rich in vitamins and minerals, all of which are also in its seeds, leaves, and juices.

gardening.name: Rice
gardening.description: Rice, Edible starchy cereal grain and the annual grass (Oryza sativa, family Poaceae) that produces it. Roughly one-half of the world's population, including almost all of East and Southeast Asia, depends on rice as its principal staple food.

gardening.name: Soya
gardening.description: soybean, (Glycine max), also called soja bean or soya bean, annual legume of the pea family (Fabaceae) and its edible seed. The soybean is economically the most important bean in the world, providing vegetable protein for millions of people and ingredients for hundreds of chemical products.

gardening.name: Spinach
gardening.description: Spinach (Spinacia oleracea) is a leafy green vegetable that originated in Persia. It belongs to the amaranth family and is related to beets and quinoa. What's more, it's considered very healthy, as it's loaded with nutrients and antioxidants. There are many ways to prepare spinach.

gardening.name: Sugarcane
gardening.description: Sugar cane is a tropical grass that grows 10–20 feet high. Unlike sugar beets, it's perennial, meaning it doesn't need to be replanted every year. When harvested, sugar cane is cut just above the root level so new sprouts will grow, ready to be harvested again in 10–12 months.

gardening.name: Tomato
gardening.description: The tomato (Solanum lycopersicum) is a fruit from the nightshade family native to South America. Despite botanically being a fruit, it's generally eaten and prepared like a vegetable. They are a great source of vitamin C, potassium, folate, and vitamin K.

gardening.name: Wheat
gardening.description: Wheat is a valuable source of essential nutrients, providing carbohydrate-based energy and fiber, protein, B vitamins, calcium, magnesium, phosphorus, potassium, zinc, and iron. In low and medium-income countries, grain-based foods still make up the central part of the diet.

gardening.name: Zucchini
gardening.description: Zucchini is a low-calorie, high volume vegetable with plenty of vitamins B6 and C. It's also a good source of potassium, folate, and vitamin A. Zucchini is considered a low-carbohydrate vegetable with plenty of fiber.

poi.name: Cursed Cave
poi.description: The Cursed Cave or Mysterious Cave is a Location where Ursula is first encountered.

poi.name: Dark Castle
poi.description: The Dark Castle is a Location accessed through a portal during the The Dark Castle. Is a darker version of the Dream Castle, with night thorns obstructing the stairs, shattered pillars, and other rubble strewn about.

poi.name: Dark Grove
poi.description:
The Dark Grove is a location where Donald Duck is encountered during the Story Quest Lost in the Dark Grove. It can be accessed through a portal found in the southwest corner of the Forest of Valor, where Kristoff will be standing outside.

To reach the Dark Grove, the Player must select Enter on the dark portal in the Forest of Valor after unlocking the biome. After the quest Lost in the Dark Grove is complete the portal will close and the Dark Grove can no longer be accessed.

poi.name: Dark Grove
poi.description:
The Deserted Island is a Location where Ariel is first encountered during her Friendship Quest The Lonely Island. It will already be placed when beginning a new game and its entrance is found in the southeast quadrant of Dazzle Beach, on the island near the Skull Rock.
To reach the island, the Player must Embark on the raft repaired during the quest The Mysterious Wreck.

poi.name: Dreamscape
poi.description: The Dreamscape is a Location accessed through a portal inside a treehouse disguised as a large rock in the Forgotten Lands during the quest Miracles Take Time.

poi.name: Elephant Graveyard
poi.description: The Elephant Graveyard is a Location. It is a specific region of the Sunlit Plateau decorated with bones and foggy lighting effects. The Giant Skull is originally found in this location.

poi.name: Herbalist Room
poi.description: The Herbalist Room is a Location. It cannot be entered until it is unlocked during the Simba Level 7 Friendship quest "Seed of Memories".

poi.name: Mystical Cave
poi.description: The Mystical Cave is a Location. It is a dark, mysterious cave that has 4 levels descending into the earth, with a pool of water and broken pillars at the lowest level.

poi.name: Ruins
poi.description: The Ruins are a Location. It is a specific region of the Forgotten Lands. The Pedestals used in the Ursula Level 10 Friendship quest "A Deal with Ursula" are found in this location.

poi.name: Secret Chamber
poi.description: The Secret Chamber is a Location where Olaf is first encountered.

poi.name: Secret Room
poi.description: The Secret Room is a Location. It will already be placed when beginning a new game and its entrance is found inside the Dream Castle, to the right after you enter, through some potted topiaries. Its entrance will not be revealed and cannot be entered until it is unlocked during the Mickey Mouse Level 10 Friendship quest "The Secret Door".

poi.name: Stardust Port
poi.description: The Stardust Port is a Location found on the third floor of the Dream Castle. Its entrance will not be unlocked until the paid Expansion Pass quest The Port of Many Worlds.

poi.name: Vitalys Mine
poi.description: The Vitalys Mine is a series of underground tunnels rich with Mining Nodes found in the Sunlit Plateau.

quests.name: Good As Gold
objectives: Talk to Scrooge McDuck about testing his shop's new security system.
Visit Scrooge McDuck's General Store.

Take photos of the following places in Scrooge McDuck's General Store:
  ‧ A door that guards more treasure than the Cave of Wonders.
  ‧ A way to reach the second floor of the shop (2)
  ‧ Ways to make quick escapes from guards
Talk to Aladdin.

Dress up in clothing that's:
  ‧ Sporty
  ‧ Dark in color
(Optional) Wait for nightfall (6 p.m. - 6 a.m.) before dressing up.
Go inside Scrooge McDuck's General Store.
Follow Aladdin inside Scrooge McDuck's General Store.
To begin Scrooge McDuck's security system test, go inside his shop and press the button on the wall beside the counter.
Talk to Aladdin inside Scrooge McDuck's General Store.
Push the button on the upstairs table in Scrooge McDuck's General Store.
Press buttons to navigate the security system to reach the first floor of Scrooge McDuck's General Store.
Deactivate Scrooge McDuck's security system by pressing the button located on the wall behind the counter.
Follow Aladdin to the vault in Scrooge McDuck's General Store.
The vault shut, and a bunch of enchanted coins escaped! Catch them! (4)
Make sure you have every Flying Coin in your Inventory
Bring every Flying Coin to Aladdin.
Go to Dreamlight Valley.
Catch every remaining Flying Coin throughout the Valley
Go inside Aladdin and Jasmine's House.
Make sure you have every Flying Coin in your Inventory
Give every Flying Coin you caught to Aladdin.
Take a picture of Aladdin with Scrooge McDuck's coins.
Listen to Aladdin and Scrooge McDuck discuss the heist in the Valley.
Talk to Aladdin.

quests.name: Bring Your Own Carpet
objectives: Talk to Merlin.

Search the Dreamlight Library for books about:
  ‧ Carpet weaving.
  ‧ Fabric enchantment.
  ‧ Flying technique.
Bring everything to Aladdin.
Talk to Minnie.

Gather the following materials:
  ‧ 4 Dream Shard.
  ‧ 4 Blue Hydrangea.
  ‧ 4 Purple Bell Flower.
  ‧ 25 Fiber.
Return to Aladdin and Jasmine's House with the carpet supplies.

Make sure you have the following materials in your Inventory:
  ‧ 4 Dream Shard.
  ‧ 4 Blue Hydrangea.
  ‧ 4 Purple Bell Flower.
  ‧ 25 Fiber.
Give the gathered materials to Aladdin.
Enchant the Dreamlight Magic Carpet using the Magic Scroll.
Talk to Aladdin.
Follow Aladdin in the Valley.

Equip the Dreamlight Magic Carpet.
  ‧ Glide through the Valley on your Dreamlight Magic Carpet tour!
Glide under the banner in the Plaza's main square, then turn left towards the Forest of Valor.
Glide to the place where the Plaza leads into the Forest of Valor.
Glide to the place where the Forest of Valor leads to Dazzle Beach.
Glide to Dazzle Beach.
Glide to the place where Dazzle Beach leads to the Peaceful Meadow.
Glide to the stairs leading down from the Peaceful Meadow to Dazzle Beach.
Glide towards the bridge on Dazzle Beach.
Glide to the wooden dock near Skull Rock.
Talk to Aladdin.

quests.name: All That Glitters
objectives:
Gather flowers in the following colors:
  ‧ 4 Yellow.
  ‧ 6 Purple.
Bring the flowers to Aladdin.
Listen to Aladdin give Jasmine the bouquet.
Talk to Aladdin.
Go to the "mermaids isle" mentioned on Aladdin's treasure scroll.
Talk to Aladdin.
Investigate Ariel's island for clues about the treasure.
Talk to Aladdin.
Search for a pillar around Ariel's island.

You uncovered a piece of the mysterious pillar!
  ‧ Search Ariel's island for the pillar's 2 missing parts.
  ‧ Repair the pillar on Ariel's island with its missing parts.
Talk to Aladdin.

Search for information about the pillar by:
  ‧ Interacting with it.
  ‧ Taking a photo of it.
Return to Dreamlight Valley.

Ask the following Villagers about the pillar on Ariel's island:
  ‧ Maui.
  ‧ Ariel.
  ‧ Rapunzel.
Return to Ariel's island.
Jasmine's on Ariel's island?! Go talk to her.
Solve the pillar on Ariel's island by rotating the parts to align the symbols.
Pillar solved! Collect the treasure.
Bring the treasure to Aladdin.
Listen to Jasmine and Aladdin discuss the treasure of the pillar.
Talk to Aladdin.

quests.name: Advanced Marketing
objectives:
Mine Gems in the following colors:
  ‧ 3 Red.
  ‧ 4 Blue.
  ‧ 5 Green.

Make sure you have Gems of the following colors in your Inventory:
  ‧ 3 Red.
  ‧ 4 Blue.
  ‧ 5 Green.
Bring the Gems to Aladdin.
Listen to Aladdin give the gems to WALL-E.
Talk to Aladdin.

Search the South Market in the Aladdin Realm for stall-building supplies.
  ‧ 1 Marketplace Stall Signage.
  ‧ 1 Marketplace Rug.
  ‧ 6 Marketplace Basket.
Bring everything to Aladdin.

Gather the following materials:
  ‧ 3 Tinkering Parts.
  ‧ 3 Gold Ingot.
  ‧ 11 Dark Wood.
  ‧ 20 Softwood.
  ‧ 27 Dry Wood.

Craft the following furniture:
  ‧ Small Marketplace Chest.
  ‧ Large Marketplace Chest.
  ‧ 2 Custom Signpost.

Make sure you have the following furniture in your Inventory:
  ‧ Small Marketplace Chest.
  ‧ Large Marketplace Chest.
  ‧ 2 Custom Signpost.
Bring everything to Aladdin.

Talk to the following Villagers:
  ‧ Goofy.
  ‧ Mulan.
  ‧ Kristoff.
  ‧ The Beast.
  ‧ Tiana.
Talk to Aladdin.
Place the Gem Stall in the Valley.

Make your own marketplace in Dreamlight Valley using:
  ‧ Small Marketplace Chest.
  ‧ Large Marketplace Chest.
  ‧ 2 Custom Signpost.
  ‧ 6 Market Decorations.
(Optional) Additional stalls from: Kristoff, Goofy, Mulan, Tiana and the Beast.
Unlock the Gem Stall.
Purchase wares from the new Gem Stall.
Talk to Aladdin.
Place the Grand Opening Balloon Arch close to the Gem Stall and celebrate the opening of the new marketplace.
Celebrate the opening of the new marketplace.
Talk to Aladdin.

quests.name: Brave the Storm
objectives:
Meet Aladdin near the edge of the roof.
  ‧ Talk to Aladdin on the rooftops.

Scavenge building materials from the South-East Rooftops:
  ‧ Pile of Planks.
  ‧ Fine Rope.
  ‧ Timber Stack.
Place the items on the roof's edge near Aladdin to make a bridge.
Talk to Aladdin on the rooftops.
Make your way farther across the Center Rooftops with Aladdin.
Talk to Aladdin on the Center Rooftops.
Find a way down to the South Market using what you've learned.
Talk to Aladdin in the South Market.
Use the Rose Water in your Inventory.

Search through the wreckage for what you'll need for the stall repairs.
  ‧ 3 Something sticky.
  ‧ 3 Fine Rope.
  ‧ 3 Timber Stack.
  ‧ 3 Bolts of Silk.
Talk to Aladdin in the South Market.
Craft 3 Stall Repair Kits at the Crafting Station near Aladdin.
Use the Stall Repair Kits on the broken South Market stalls.
Return to Aladdin in the South Market.

quests.name: Monkey Business
objectives: Talk to Jasmine in the South Market about the strange amulet.
Explore the rooftops near the South Market to find where the Enchanted Gemstones could have gone.

The monkeys have the gemstones!
  ‧ Talk to the monkeys.

The monkeys have the Enchanted Gemstones?!
  ‧ Talk to Aladdin about the monkeys.
Find 3 Golden Bananas to trade to the monkeys in exchange for the Amulet's gemstones
Trade the Golden Bananas to the monkeys for the Amulet's gemstones.
Pick up the gemstones.
Bring the Amulet's gemstones to Aladdin.
Wear the protective Amulet to safely explore the sandstorms.
Explore the sandstorms for anything to help.
Return to Aladdin in the South Market.

quests.name: Carpet Diem
objectives: Interact with the Magic Carpet to fly up toward the Windcaller.
Return to the Windcaller using the Magic Carpet.

Use your Pickaxe to destroy each of the Windcaller's Crystals:
  ‧ Red Crystal.
  ‧ Yellow Crystal.
  ‧ Blue Crystal.
  ‧ Green Crystal.
Return to Agrabah.
Talk to Aladdin in the Central Market.
Talk to Jasmine in the Central Market.
Return to the Valley and place Aladdin and Jasmine's House.
Unlock Aladdin and Jasmine's House using the Scrooge McDuck Sign.
Welcome Jasmine.
Talk to Jasmine.
Return to the Aladdin Realm and talk to Aladdin in the Central Market.
Return to the Valley with Aladdin.
Welcome Aladdin.
Talk to Aladdin.
Equip the Magic Carpet from the Companions section of your Inventory, then take a picture with him!

quests.name: Books with No Pictures
objectives: Speak with Vanellope about hanging out with Alice.
Go inside the Dreamlight Library.
Talk to Alice and Vanellope.

Find someone who has a clue about the location of the Magical Nouns.
  ‧ Mickey Mouse.
  ‧ Goofy.
  ‧ Scrooge McDuck.
Fish 3 Magical Nouns from ponds in the Peaceful Meadow.
Bring the Magical Nouns to Alice.
The Magical Verbs have fled to the Dream Castle. Go catch them!
Catch the 3 Magical Verbs within the Dream Castle.
Make sure you have all the Magical Verbs in your Inventory.

quests.name: Curiouser and Curiouser...
objectives:
You've cleared away the ink blocking the way, and discovered a new part of Everafter.
  ‧ Explore the Teapot Falls.

The way forward is blocked by those curious giant teacups.
  ‧ Take a picture of them.

The way is blocked, and there are no clues about how to proceed...

Maybe a Villager who's spent more time in Everafter knows what these are...

  ‧ 5 Pink Frog Snippet.

  ‧ Hanging out with your squire (Flynn!).
  ‧ (Optional) Tame any Baby Dragon in Everafter.

You are officially a knight! Congratulations, the Brave.
  ‧ Lower the drawbridge to the Fallen Fortress.

The drawbridge is lowered!
  ‧ Enter the Fortress grounds and activate the Fairy Tale Trial with your Royal Net.

spoilers.objective:
The symbols around the Pillar of Unity match the other pillars.

Using furniture mode, move the restored pillars so they are placed on their respective color & symbol. There are seven in total which must be moved and placed.

Starting from the position closest to the raft and moving clockwise, the Pillar order is as follows:

1. Pillar of Friendship (Peaceful Meadow)
2. Pillar of Trust (Glade of Trust)
3. Pillar of Nurturing (Sunlit Plateau)
4. Pillar of Remembrance (Forgotten Lands)
5. Pillar of Love (Frosted Heights)
6. Pillar of Courage (Forest of Valor)
7. Pillar of Power (Dazzle Beach)

Follow Woody to Dazzle Beach
Gather 3 Wheat
Catch 2 fresh Cod
Make sure you have the Ingredients for Goofy in your Inventory.
Talk to Woody
Make sure you have the Ingredients for Goofy's dinner in your Inventory.
Bring the Ingredients to Goofy
Meet Woody at the Carousel
Clean up the Trash in the Carousel (7)
Investigate the Memory in the Carousel.
Return to Woody.

quests.name: A Bit of a Fixer Upper
objectives: Go see Kristoff.

Gather the following materials:
  ‧ 12 Softwood
  ‧ 5 Hardwood
  ‧ 2 Fabric
  ‧ 1 Iron Ingot
Craft the Carousel Repair Kit
Make sure the Carousel Repair Kit is in your Inventory
Give the Carousel Repair Kit to Woody.
Talk to Woody

quests.name: Wanted: Aliens
objectives:
Gather the materials for the new Claw Machine
  ‧ 10 Hardwood
  ‧ 2 Iron Ingot
  ‧ 12 Glass
Craft the new Claw Machine
Meet with Woody inside the Carousel
Make sure you have the Claw Machine in your Inventory
Bring the Claw Machine to Woody
Talk to Buzz
Find the Alien Toys:
Under Dazzle Beach's sand
Frozen in ice near a waterfall
In the ground near the Giant Willow
In Scar's Cave
Give the Alien Toys to Woody

quests.name: The Illumination
objectives: Examine the toy chest in the Carousel.
Pick up the Old Ruler's Lost Diary Page in the Carousel.
Talk to Woody

Get a childhood item from:
  ‧ Moana
  ‧ Ariel
  ‧ Kristoff

Make sure you have the items from the Villagers in your Inventory.
  ‧ Tiny Troll Figure
  ‧ Conch
  ‧ Music Box
Bring the items from the Villagers to Woody

Gather the materials for the Blanket Fort:
  ‧ 40 Softwood
  ‧ 5 Cotton
  ‧ 4 Fabric
  ‧ 4 Rope
  ‧ 5 Glass
Craft the Blanket Fort
Have the perfect slumber party with Woody:
Put on some Playful clothes (optional)
Place the Blanket Fort when you're ready
Take a picture with Buzz and Woody
Meet Woody at the Carousel
Talk to Woody.
Talk to Woody..

quests.name: You're My Favorite Deputy
objectives: Talk to Woody in the Toy Story Realm

Gather the following materials in the Toy Story Realm:
  ‧ 8 Ice Pop Stick
  ‧ 5 Pipe Cleaner
Bring the materials to Woody

Gather the rest of the materials in Dreamlight Valley:
  ‧ 2 Yellow Daisy
  ‧ Talk to Buzz about something to hold the farm together.

Make sure you have the following materials in your Inventory:
  ‧ 2 Yellow Daisy
  ‧ 1 Adhesive Bonding Agent
Bring the materials to Woody in the Toy Story Realm
Go meet Woody at Bonnie's farm beside the bed.
Talk to Woody
Search the room for the Origami Animal (5)
Bring the Origami Animals to Woody.
Place Woody's Carousel in Dreamlight Valley.
Use the Scrooge McDuck sign to pay for the construction of Woody's Carousel.
Use the Scrooge McDuck sign to pay for the construction of Woody's Carousel.
Welcome Woody to the Village

When harvested, sugar cane is cut just above the root level so new sprouts will grow, ready to be harvested again in 10–12 months.

universes.name: A Bug's Life
universes.description: A Bug's Life is a Universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the animated film A Bug's Life (1998).

universes.name: Aladdin

universes.name: Alice in Wonderland
universes.description: Alice in Wonderland is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Alice in Wonderland (1951), which is based on the novel Alice's Adventures in Wonderland by Lewis Carroll.

universes.name: Atlantis
universes.description: Atlantis is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Atlantis: The Lost Empire (2001).

universes.name: Beauty and the Beast
universes.description: Beauty and the Beast is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Beauty and the Beast (1991).

universes.name: Big Hero 6
universes.description: Big Hero 6 is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Big Hero 6 (2014) and its franchise.

universes.name: Brave
universes.description:
Brave is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Pixar animated film Brave (2012).
The film features Princess Merida, who is determined to make her own path in life, and defies a custom that brings chaos to her kingdom. Granted one wish, Merida must rely on her bravery and her archery skills to undo a beastly curse.

universes.name: Cars
universes.description: Cars is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Pixar animated film Cars (2006) and its sequels Cars 2 (2011) and Cars 3 (2017).

universes.name: Cinderella
universes.description: Cinderella is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Cinderella (1950), which is based on the fairy tale by Charles Perrault.

universes.name: Coco
universes.description: Coco is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Pixar animated film Coco (2017).

universes.name: Disney Fairies
universes.description: Disney Fairies is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based around the character Tinker Bell of the Disney animated film Peter Pan (1953).

universes.name: Disney
universes.description: Disney is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the the real life Disney Parks or otherwise generally related to Disney.

universes.name: Dreamlight Valley
universes.description: Dreamlight Valley is the universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley which is based on the world where the game takes place.

universes.name: Elemental
universes.description: Elemental is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Pixar animated film Elemental (2023).

universes.name: Encanto
universes.description: Encanto is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Encanto (2021).

universes.name: Enchanted
universes.description: Enchanted is a Universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the live-action film Enchanted (2007) and its sequel Disenchanted (2022).

universes.name: Fantasia
universes.description: Fantasia is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Fantasia (1940).

universes.name: Finding Nemo
universes.description: Finding Nemo is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Pixar animated film Finding Nemo (2003) and its sequel Finding Dory (2016).

universes.name: Frozen
universes.description: Frozen is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Frozen (2013) and the sequel films Frozen II (2019) and the upcoming Frozen III (2027). It is loosely based on Hans Christian Anderson's fairytale The Snow Queen.

universes.name: Hercules
universes.description: Hercules is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Hercules (1997).

universes.name: Hocus Pocus
universes.description: Hocus Pocus is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney live action film Hocus Pocus (1993) and its sequel Hocus Pocus 2 (2022).

universes.name: Inside Out
universes.description: Inside Out is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Pixar franchise Inside Out, which includes the original 2015 film of the same name and its 2024 sequel, Inside Out 2.

universes.name: Lady and the Tramp
universes.description: Lady and the Tramp is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Lady and the Tramp (1955).

universes.name: Lightyear
universes.description: Lightyear is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Pixar animated film Lightyear (2022).

universes.name: Lilo & Stitch
universes.description: Lilo & Stitch is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Lilo & Stitch (2002).

universes.name: Maleficent
universes.description:
Maleficent is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney live action film Maleficent (2014).
The film is a retelling of the Disney animated film Sleeping Beauty (1959), but tells the story from the perspective of the evil fairy Maleficent.

universes.name: Mickey & Friends
universes.description: Mickey & Friends is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on Disney's classic characters from Mickey Mouse animated shorts and comics.

universes.name: Moana
universes.description:
Moana is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Moana (2016).
The film is set in ancient Polynesia, where a terrible curse incurred by the demigod Maui reaches Moana's island and she answers the ocean's call to seek out the demigod to set things right.

universes.name: Monsters, Inc.
universes.description:
Monsters, Inc. is a Universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Pixar animated film Monsters, Inc. (2001) and the prequel film Monsters University (2013).
In the original film, to power their city monsters have to harnesses the screams of human children for energy. Children are believed to be toxic to the monsters, but after a child gets through to their world monsters Mike and Sulley realize things may not be what they think.

universes.name: Mulan
universes.description:
Mulan is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Mulan (1998).
The film tells the story of Fa Mulan, who impersonates a man to take her father's place in a mandatory military enlistment to counter a Hun invasion during an unspecified Imperial dynasty of China.

universes.name: Oswald the Lucky Rabbit
universes.description:
Oswald the Lucky Rabbit is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated short films starring the character Oswald the Lucky Rabbit.
Oswald the Lucky Rabbit is a character from the Disney franchise, known for his mischievous personality and adventures. He is often seen as a precursor to Mickey Mouse.

universes.name: Peter Pan
universes.description:
Peter Pan is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Peter Pan (1953).
The film tells the story of the adventurous Peter Pan who whisks Wendy, John, and Michael Darling away to the faraway world of Neverland, where they encounter mermaids, pirates, and the villainous Captain Hook.

universes.name: Pirates of the Caribbean
universes.description:
Pirates of the Caribbean is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Pirates of the Caribbean franchise, which originated with the Disneyland theme park ride of the same name that opened in 1967.
The theme park ride has been adapted into films and books that primarily follow the adventures of pirate Captain Jack Sparrow, including the Pirates of the Caribbean film series.

universes.name: Pocahontas
universes.description:
Pocahontas is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Pocahontas (1995).
The film romanticizes Pocahontas' encounter with John Smith and her legendary saving of his life.

universes.name: Ratatouille
universes.description:
Ratatouille is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Pixar animated film Ratatouille (2007).
The film stars Remy, a rat with a passion for cooking, and follows his journey to become a chef in Paris.

universes.name: Raya And The Last Dragon
universes.description:
Raya And The Last Dragon is a Universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Raya and the Last Dragon (2021).
The film features a realm known as Kumandra, a re-imagined Earth inhabited by an ancient civilization, where a warrior named Raya is determined to find Sisu, the last dragon.

universes.name: Sleeping Beauty
universes.description:
Sleeping Beauty is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Sleeping Beauty (1959), which is based on the fairy tale by Charles Perrault.
The film stars princess Aurora, who is cursed by Maleficent to die from a prick with the spindle of a spinning wheel, but is saved by the three good fairies, who alter the curse so that she instead fall into a deep sleep to be awakened by true love's kiss.

universes.name: Snow White
universes.description:
Snow White is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937).
The film stars Snow White, whom an Evil Queen attempts to have her murdered in jealousy of her beauty. She escapes and is given shelter by seven Dwarfs in their cottage in the forest.

universes.name: Star Wars
universes.description:
Star Wars is a Universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the film franchise Star Wars.
The films tell the story of a long galactic war between the heroic Jedi and the tyrannical Sith.

universes.name: Tangled
universes.description:
Tangled is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Tangled (2010), which is based on the fairy tale Rapunzel by the Brothers Grimm.
The film stars Rapunzel, a lost young princess with magical long blonde hair who was stolen from her parents by the vain Mother Gothel and yearns to leave her secluded tower. She accepts the aid of thief Flynn Rider to take her out into the world which she has never seen.

universes.name: The Emperor's New Groove
universes.description:
The Emperor's New Groove is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film The Emperor's New Groove (2000).
In the film, young, self-centered emperor Kuzco is accidentally transformed into a llama by his ex-advisor Yzma and her henchman Kronk. To become human again, he must rely on Pacha, a village leader to help him return to the palace.

universes.name: The Incredibles
universes.description:
The Incredibles is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Pixar animated film The Incredibles (2004), and its sequel film Incredibles 2 (2018).
The films feature a family of undercover superheroes trying to lead a quiet suburban life who are forced into action to save the world.

universes.name: The Lion King
universes.description:
The Lion King is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film The Lion King (1994).
The film features lion prince Simba, who is targeted by his bitter uncle, Scar, who wants to ascend the throne himself. When Scar falsely accuses Simba of killing his father Mufasa, Simba flees the Pride Lands and meets Timon and Pumbaa. After reuniting with childhood friend Nala and meeting the wise Rafiki, Simba returns to the Pride Lands and confronts Scar.

universes.name: The Little Mermaid
universes.description:
The Little Mermaid is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film The Little Mermaid (1989).
It stars Ariel, a mermaid who longs to walk on land. She strikes a deal with Ursula to become human in order to win the love of Prince Eric.

universes.name: The Princess and the Frog
universes.description:
The Princess and the Frog is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film The Princess and the Frog (2009).
The film stars Tiana, a waitress desperate to fulfill her dreams as a restaurant owner, set on a journey to turn a frog prince back into a human being, but she has to face the same problem after she kisses him.

universes.name: The Sword in the Stone
universes.description:
The Sword in the Stone is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film The Sword in the Stone (1963).
The film is a retelling of the story of King Arthur, featuring a young Arthur as he is taught the art of kingship with the help of the wizard Merlin and his owl Archimedes.
The film was the last animated Disney film released during Walt Disney's lifetime.

universes.name: Tim Burton's The Nightmare Before Christmas
universes.description:
Tim Burton's The Nightmare Before Christmas is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the stop-motion film The Nightmare Before Christmas (1993).
The film tells the story of Jack Skellington, the Pumpkin King of Halloween Town, who stumbles upon Christmas Town and schemes to take over the holiday. After his takeover ends in disaster, Jack rescues Santa Claus from the villainous Oogie Boogie.

universes.name: Toy Story
universes.description:
Toy Story is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Toy Story franchise, which includes the Pixar animated films Toy Story (1995), Toy Story 2 (1999), Toy Story 3 (2010), Toy Story 4 (2019), and the upcoming Toy Story 5 (2026).
The films involve the adventures of a group of toys, specifically that of a cowboy sheriff toy named Woody and a space ranger toy named Buzz Lightyear, who come to life when they are not in the sight of humans.

universes.name: Tron
universes.description:
Tron is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney film Tron (1982).
The film is about Kevin Flynn, a computer programmer and video game developer who is transported inside the software world of a mainframe computer where he interacts with programs in his attempt to escape.

universes.name: Turning Red
universes.description:
Turning Red is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Pixar animated film Turning Red (2022).
The film stars a thirteen-year-old girl named Mei Lee, who is torn between staying her mother's dutiful daughter and the changes of adolescence. If those challenges were not enough, whenever she gets overly excited she transforms into a giant red panda.

universes.name: Up
universes.description:
Up is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Pixar animated film Up (2009).
The film stars 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen, who travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway, a Wilderness Explorer boy named Russell. Along their journey, they encounter a giant bird that Russell names Kevin and a "talking", friendly dog named Dug.

universes.name: WALL-E
universes.description: WALL-E is a character from the Disney-Pixar film WALL-E (2008). He is unlocked after opening the WALL-E Realm and completing the quest The Shy Little Robot.

universes.name: Winnie the Pooh
universes.description: Winnie the Pooh (Universe) is a Universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the animated Winnie the Pooh shorts and films, which in turn, are based on the books by A.A. Milne.

universes.name: Wreck-It Ralph
universes.description:
Wreck-It Ralph is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Wreck-It Ralph (2012) and its sequel Ralph Breaks the Internet (2018).
The films star Ralph, the eponymous arcade game villain who rebels against his "bad-guy" role and dreams of becoming a hero. After obtaining a medal from Hero's Duty, he ends up in the racing game Sugar Rush and meets Vanellope, and they become best friends.

universes.name: Zootopia
universes.description:
Zootopia is a universe in Disney Dreamlight Valley based on the Disney animated film Zootopia (2016).
The film follows rookie police officer rabbit Judy Hopps teaming up with con artist fox Nick Wilde to uncover a conspiracy involving the disappearance of predators.
